data.Title: Google Ruled a Monopoly for Antitrust Violations
data.Description: A federal judge has ruled that Google is a monopolist, citing its practice of paying billions of dollars to companies like Apple to secure its position as the default search engine. This decision could have significant implications for Google's business practices and the entire ad media industry.

data.Title: Apple Confirms Its Own Search Index of "Billions" of Websites
data.Description: As part of the DOJ ruling that Google is a monopoly, documents revealed that Apple has its own search index consisting of "billions" of websites. The specific number was redacted, but it stated, "Apple maintains an index of about X billion websites."

data.Title: Google Ads Accidentally Issues Million-Dollar Credits in Bug
data.Description: Google Ads accidentally issued million-dollar ad credits to some Local Service Ads advertisers. Google has confirmed that these credits were a bug and is working to resolve the issue.

data.Title: Google Local Service Ads Now Display Photos, Potentially Impacting Ad Rank
data.Description: Google Local Service Ads will now display photos from advertisers' profiles. These photos can potentially improve an ad's ranking, making it more important for businesses to optimize their visual content.

data.Title: Google Search Testing "You May Like" Snippet Labels
data.Description: Google is testing new labels for search snippets that say "You may like." This appears to be a way to personalize search results and show users content that is more relevant to their interests.

data.Title: Googlebot Crawling: Factors That Influence Crawl Frequency
data.Description: Google has affirmed three factors that can increase Googlebot crawling, prompting discussions about how search engines crawl the web and common misconceptions around crawl frequency.
